companies.name: Slack
companies.description:
Slack is a team communication application providing services such as real-time
messaging, archiving, and search for modern teams.
companies.overview:
Slack is a team communication application providing services such as real-time
messaging, archiving, and to search for modern teams. It offers one-on-one
messaging, private groups, persistent chat rooms, and direct messaging as well
as group chats organized by topic. All content inside Slack is searchable from
one search box and it integrates with a number of third-party services,
including [Google Docs](/product/google-docs), [Dropbox](/organization/dropbox),
[Heroku](/organization/heroku),
[Crashlytics](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/crashlytics),
[GitHub](/organization/github), and [Zendesk](/organization/zendesk). Slack was
launched in 2013 by [Serguei Mourachov](/person/serguei-mourachov), [Eric
Costello](/person/eric-costello), [Cal Henderson](/person/cal-henderson), and
[Stewart Butterfield](/person/stewart-butterfield). It is based in [San
Francisco, C.A.](/location/san-francisco/528f5e3c90d111115d1c2e4ff979d58e) The
application is available for [Mac](/product/mac), PC, [iOS](/product/ios), and
[Android](/product/android).
companies.top_keywords: enterprise software, unifed communications, collaboration, computer software, workplace messaging
companies.investors_string: Accel, SV Angel, Andreessen Horowitz, Social Capital, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Google Ventures, Slow Ventures, IVP, Horizons Ventures, DST Global, Index Ventures, Spark Capital, Groupe Arnault
companies.top_exec_schools_string: University of California, Berkeley, Wellesley College, The University of Texas at Austin, Birmingham City University, Widener University, Chester

comments.text: Insane usage! "TechCrunch understands that the company is currently clocking up 250,000 daily active users, and that in its freemium business model, about one-third of its "seats" are paid. As a point of comparison, at the end of April the company had 60,000 daily active users and 15,000 paid seats."
